Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: jimmy \jim"my\, n.; pl. {jimmies}. [Rhyming slang: Jimmy Grant, for immigrant. --RHUD] An immigrant. [Australian slang] [PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: jimmy \jim"my\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {jimmied}; p. pr. & vb. n. {jimmying}.] To pry open (a door, window, etc.) with a jimmy or similar device; often used with open; as, the burglar jimmied open the back door and stole the TV set. [PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Jimmy \Jim"my\, n.; pl. {Jimmies}. [Cf. {Jemmy}.] A short crowbar used by burglars in breaking open doors. [Written also {jemmy}.] [1913 Webster]

jimmy n : a short crowbar; "in England they call a jimmy and jemmy" [syn: {jemmy}] v : to move or force, especially in an effort to get something open; "The burglar jimmied the lock", "Raccoons managed to pry the lid off the garbage pail" [syn: {pry}, {prise}, {prize}, {lever}] [also: {jimmied}]
